decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the board through a variety of removal spells and enchantments like Doom Foretold and Extinction Event. It also includes creatures like Archon of Sun's Grace and Polukranos, Unchained to establish a board presence. Yorion, Sky Nomad serves as a companion and can blink permanents, generating value and disrupting the opponent's game plan. The mana base is flexible with a variety of pathways and triomes to ensure consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and control the game until it can establish a winning position.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and milling the opponent's deck with cards like Ruin Crab and Into the Story. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building card advantage through card draw and graveyard recursion. The deck also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion to provide additional value by casting low-cost permanents from the graveyard. By efficiently managing resources and hindering the opponent's game plan, this deck aims to outlast and outplay the opponent in a 1 vs 1 matchup.

The key concept of this Dimir Control deck is to utilize a combination of mill cards and disruptive spells to control the game and outvalue the opponent. By consistently milling the opponent's library with cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, while also disrupting their game plan with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and removal spells like Heartless Act, the deck aims to gain card advantage and tempo advantage to ultimately secure victory with powerful finishers like Into the Story and Lullmage's Domination.

The deck focuses on utilizing mill and control strategies to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By using cards like Ruin Crab and Into the Story, the deck aims to deplete the opponent's deck quickly while countering threats with cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a Companion adds additional value by allowing for recursion of key cards. Ultimately, the deck aims to outlast the opponent by controlling the board and depleting their resources through mill and disruption.

The focus of this Control - Dimir Control deck is to establish early board presence with mill cards like Ruin Crab and Thieves' Guild Enforcer, while controlling the opponent's resources with counterspells like Mystical Dispute and removal spells like Heartless Act. By utilizing card advantage and disruption, the deck aims to slow down the opponent's game plan and ultimately win through milling the opponent's library with cards like Drown in the Loch and Soaring Thought-Thief, or by establishing a dominant position with powerful cards like Into the Story and Agadeem's Awakening.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by utilizing mill cards like Ruin Crab, Merfolk Windrobber, and Soaring Thought-Thief to deplete the opponent's library. Combined with counter spells like Disdainful Stroke and Mystical Dispute, along with removal spells like Heartless Act, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's plans while fueling its own graveyard with Drown in the Loch. Into the Story provides card advantage, while Lurrus of the Dream-Den allows for recursion of cheap permanents. Agadeem's Awakening offers a late-game threat, and efficient mana fixing ensures a smooth mana curve.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's actions through counterspells and removal while utilizing mill as a win condition. It takes advantage of cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Ruin Crab to mill the opponent's deck, while also using cards like Drown in the Loch and Heartless Act to control the board and eliminate threats. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building card advantage with Into the Story and Of One Mind, eventually overwhelming them with a depleted deck.

This deck focuses on utilizing evasive creatures and disruptive spells to put pressure on the opponent and control the board. By combining aggressive creature cards like Thieves' Guild Enforcer and Soaring Thought-Thief with versatile removal spells like Heartless Act and Eliminate, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while dealing consistent damage. The deck also includes powerful card draw spells like Into the Story to maintain card advantage and fuel its aggressive strategy. With a mix of evasion, disruption, and card advantage, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and efficiently.

This deck focuses on overwhelming the opponent with fast and aggressive creatures like Robber of the Rich, Lovestruck Beast, and Goldspan Dragon. By using cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Magda, Brazen Outlaw to generate card advantage and mana acceleration, the deck aims to quickly build a threatening board presence. Embercleave and Rimrock Knight provide additional burst damage, while cards like Bonecrusher Giant and Shatterskull Smashing help to control the board. Fabled Passage and Cragcrown Pathway ensure mana consistency, allowing the deck to consistently apply pressure and close out games quickly.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a strong and aggressive creature presence. The deck utilizes powerful creatures like Questing Beast, Bonecrusher Giant, and Brushfire Elemental to quickly close out games. The goal is to establish early board control with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Lovestruck Beast, while also utilizing cards like Embercleave and Shatterskull Smashing to deal massive amounts of damage in the late game. The deck aims to be proactive and pressure the opponent constantly to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. The deck focuses on using creatures with high power and toughness like Lovestruck Beast, Questing Beast, and Bonecrusher Giant to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It also utilizes cards like Edgewall Innkeeper, Brushfire Elemental, and Kazandu Mammoth to generate card advantage and maintain board presence. The inclusion of Embercleave and The Great Henge further amplifies the deck's aggression and allows for devastating attacks. The deck also has some versatile removal options like Fire Prophecy and The Akroan War to control the opponent's board.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain a high tempo and pressure on the opponent by consistently playing low-cost aggressive creatures and spells. The deck focuses on utilizing cards like Improbable Alliance and Faerie Vandal to generate value while pushing damage. Teferi, Master of Time provides card advantage and control, with cards like Neutralize helping to disrupt your opponent's game plan. The deck also includes burn spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Irencrag Pyromancer to finish off the opponent quickly. Overall, the key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with fast-paced aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly cycle through cards in order to activate abilities like Flourishing Fox, Drannith Stinger, and Irencrag Pyromancer, allowing for a fast and aggressive playstyle. By cycling through the deck, players can build up their resources and eventually cast Zenith Flare for a big finish. The deck also includes removal spells like Startling Development and Frostveil Ambush to control the board and protect key creatures. Mana fixing lands like Raugrin Triome and pathways help ensure the deck runs smoothly and efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent quickly with aggressive red creatures and powerful direct damage spells. By utilizing low-cost creatures like Fervent Champion and Robber of the Rich, along with powerful finishers like Embercleave and Torbran, Thane of Red Fell, this deck aims to close out the game before the opponent has a chance to stabilize. With a mix of burn spells and resilient creatures, this deck is designed to maintain pressure and quickly defeat the opponent.

This deck aims to establish control over the game through a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and powerful threats. By ramping up mana with cards like Cultivate and Wolfwillow Haven, the deck can quickly access its high-cost cards like Emergent Ultimatum and Alrund's Epiphany. Yorion, Sky Nomad provides additional value by blinking permanents for extra ETB effects. The deck also includes some versatile cards like Shadows' Verdict and Binding the Old Gods to handle a variety of threats. Overall, the goal is to outvalue the opponent and dictate the pace of the game.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells and powerful threats to outvalue opponents. By utilizing Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion, the deck aims to generate incremental advantage through blinking permanents for value. With a mix of counterspells, removal, and card draw, the deck aims to control the board and set up for powerful late-game plays with Emergent Ultimatum. The mana base is designed to support the deck's three-color combination, ensuring consistency in casting spells and enabling powerful plays.

The deck focuses on utilizing control elements to disrupt opponent's strategies and gain advantage, while also ramping up mana to cast powerful spells and ultimatums. It includes a variety of removal spells, card draw, and versatile threats like Valki and Elder Gargaroth. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for additional value and flexibility in longer games. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the three-color combination and ensure smooth gameplay. Overall, the deck aims to outlast opponents and win through attrition and overwhelming card advantage.

The key concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between aggressive creatures and powerful spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal massive damage. By utilizing efficient creatures like Goldspan Dragon and Bonecrusher Giant, alongside disruptive cards like Mystical Dispute and Saw it Coming, the deck aims to maintain board presence and control the game tempo. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances the damage output of the deck, ensuring a swift victory through aggressive plays and calculated decision-making.

This deck focuses on utilizing the powerful creatures and spells in the Temur colors to aggressively push damage through to the opponent. By including Obosh as a companion, the deck enhances its ability to deal damage quickly and efficiently. The key strategy relies on playing strong creatures like Goldspan Dragon, Elder Gargaroth, and Brazen Borrower to dominate the board while using efficient removal spells like Bonecrusher Giant and Purphoros's Intervention to control the opponent's threats. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with strong creatures and spells while maintaining a high tempo.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggression. The key strategy is to maintain a strong board presence through efficient creatures like Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast, while also having access to impactful spells like The Great Henge and Alrund's Epiphany to maintain pressure and control the game. The inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion enhances damage output and synergy with odd-costed cards in the deck. The mana base is designed to support a three color strategy with the use of pathways and triomes for consistency.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful creatures with aggressive abilities to quickly overwhelm your opponent. By utilizing cards like Bonecrusher Giant, Lovestruck Beast, and Elder Gargaroth, combined with support cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge, the deck aims to efficiently curve out and deal consistent damage. Additionally, the inclusion of Obosh, the Preypiercer as a companion adds a unique twist to further enhance the deck's aggressive strategy. The mana base is created to ensure consistent color access to cast all spells efficiently.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between powerful aggressive creatures like Elder Gargaroth, Goldspan Dragon, and Lovestruck Beast with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and The Great Henge to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Bonecrusher Giant provide additional disruption and removal options, while the use of Mystic Dispute and Saw It Coming helps to protect your creatures and maintain control of the tempo. The mana base is optimized for consistency and speed, allowing for smooth mana curves and efficient plays.

This deck focuses on deploying aggressive creatures such as Bonecrusher Giant and Lovestruck Beast to quickly overwhelm opponents. The key strategy involves utilizing Lukka, Coppercoat Outcast to cheat out powerful creatures like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and generate card advantage with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper. Control elements like Brazen Borrower and counter spells are included to disrupt opponents' strategies. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to the necessary colors to cast spells efficiently. Overall, the deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain momentum to secure victory.

The deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures to pressure the opponent early on, while also having some control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to generate card advantage with cards like Edgewall Innkeeper and Llanowar Visionary, while also utilizing powerful threats like Koma, Cosmos Serpent and Lovestruck Beast. The deck also includes a small counter package to deal with opposing threats and protect its own creatures. By efficiently managing its resources and applying early pressure, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.
